text: Upper Volta was a territory belonging to France from 1919 to 1932 and later from 1947 to 1958. In 1958, Upper Volta became a republic. Until 1960, it was still part of the French Community. In 1960, Upper Volta gained independence from France. In 1984, it became the country now known as Burkina Faso. == References == * Burkina Faso (Upper Volta) at Nations Encyclopedia Category:History of Burkina Faso Category:French colonial empire Category:Former colonies in Africa
title: Upper Volta
